title: (x) fonts from websites - Adobe Kepler, Paralucent, DIN 1451 Mittelschrift, Gotham Rounded {Lex, James Newton}
content:
I need some help IDing some fonts from a few websites. Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bleedfont.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20110429073212/http:/typophile.com/files/bleedfont.JPG) | 14.76 KB |
| [hungryfont.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20110429073212/http:/typophile.com/files/hungryfont.JPG) | 39.31 KB |
| [spiceboxfont.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20110429073212/http:/typophile.com/files/spiceboxfont.JPG) | 11.66 KB |
| [IMG00030.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110429073212/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG00030.jpg) | 135.27 KB |
author: alanlu

comments.content:
"Fifty years of Helvetica" might be [Kepler.](http://web.archive.org/web/20110429073212/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=ADT0003468)

- Lex

"NEWS" is probably the thin weight of [Paralucent.](http://web.archive.org/web/20110429073212/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/device_fonts/paralucent_b/?sample_text=NEWS%20SHOWCASE&sample_size=36)

- Lex

Doesn't Print magazine use Gotham ROUNDED? in fact, didn't they commission it?

JN

Could be - it's hard to tell from the sample.

- Lex
